intro: Escallonia andina, commonly known as Andean firebush, is a shrub native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Escallonia andina is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
